title: Set - charge move through mag field

content.description: Students set up a <math alttext="25 microtesla" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> magnetic field over their lab table. The field is directed vertically downward.
content.question: Particle 1 of charge <math alttext="lowercase q sub 1, equals positive 3 uppercase Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="uppercase Q, equals 1 microcoulomb" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, now enters the region with velocity <math alttext="6.5 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> at an angle of <math alttext="30 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>30</mtext><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, as shown above. The magnitude and and the direction measured counterclockwise to the <math alttext="positive x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> - axis of the magnetic force on particle 1 is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="2.44, times 10 to the negative 10 power, newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.44</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at an angle of <math alttext="300 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>300</mn><mo>°</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.44, times 10 to the negative 10 power, newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.44</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at an angle of <math alttext="120 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo>°</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4.22, times 10 to the negative 10 power, newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.22</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at an angle of <math alttext="300 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>300</mn><mo>°</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4.88, times 10 to the negative 10 power, newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.88</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at an angle of <math alttext="300 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>300</mn><mo>°</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4.88, times 10 to the negative 10 power, newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.88</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at an angle of <math alttext="120 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo>°</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4.88, times 10 to the negative 10 power, newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.88</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at an angle of <math alttext="120 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo>°</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
